author: jeffghome2020
title: StoryTime - A Writers Marketplace
description: Writers are subjected to unfair treatment as a result of their views and stories. Their freedom and rights are often at risk.

f6_assessments.q0: From my understanding, this proposal aims to create a marketplace for writers to share and sell their work, where the authors can choose to be anonymous, but still maintain the transparency and benefits of blockchain technology. Working in the cultural sector and being involved in the cryptocurrency space, I would say that there has not been proper development with dApps connected to the arts and culture. Artists suffer from companies grabbing hold of most of the profit, and are still controlled by the middle hand in what content to create. This proposal would be a step towards developing a place where authors can create and manage their works independently, if executed correctly. The problem statement is clear in its description, as is the solution to the problem. At first glance, this proposal seems to be a lot more niched towards only the authors, but after some thought this project also aims to connect to the consumers (of course) which make it a whole different story in terms of outreach and adoption. It could very well be a good use of the Catalyst treasury, with a lot of potential to scale in the future if executed correctly. Best case scenario (according to the proposer) this would be one of the first decentralized libraries, if all goes well. I agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer/team has experience with having proposals funded in Fund4 and Fund6, which speaks of the credibility and competency of the team. Here it would be beneficial if the proposal included a set of links to further verify the competency of the core team members. This could be links to their LinkedIn-profiles, or links to what proposals the team already have received funding for. There is youtube video provided featuring the founder (which is very good), but I would've liked some more detailed information related to this proposal. The proposal DOES include valuable contact information to the core team members, which is rarely seen in proposals (from my experience as a Community Advisor). 
The statement that the team means to reimburse the funds for this proposal within a year speaks of high levels of commitment to the project and the community, but it would be nice to have more detailed information of where this money will come from and will be distributed throughout the year. The budget allocation is pretty straightforward and includes a plan of hiring developers with the necessary competency, presented with working hours and an estimation of hourly wage over a longer timeframe (approximately 2 months time, 1 full time dev and 2 part time devs). There is a part of the budget allocation that will go to the founder for working 30 hours per week, but it would be nice to have a short breakdown of what is included in that work-package. Is it marketing, managing this project only or other projects? If the founder will be working 30 hours per week on this project, does that mean that he/she won't be part of the other projects?  The feasibility of the proposal would be a lot stronger if we could know more details about the dApp itself, as of know the proposal mostly feature the core idea but not much detail. What functions will it have apart from uploading/buying material? Will the buyers be anonymous and how will it be distributed? Will it be incorporating NFTs, and how will that function? I know that these might be "obvious" questions, but if the goal is to have a big outreach to people with varied experience of working with Cardano and Blockchain technology in general, I believe it would be beneficial if the proposal included this information. Because of the reasons stated above, I neither disagree nor agree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
In order to measure the auditability in a clear and structured way, I would suggest that the proposer should add much more detail in regards to the development and process of the project. It would be incredibly beneficial if we could see a clear roadmap with milestones, and with the inclusion of an estimated timeframe. At the moment we can only see that the proposer means to create a marketplace, but what are the steps in creating a marketplace for authors? Where is the project after 3 months, 6 months, 9 months and 12 months? What social channels will the community be able to follow the progress of the project? I would also suggest to include some measurements of success in order to monitor the development (KPIs and metrics). How many users will be expected during the first month, or after 6 months?  If I understand things correctly, Cardano Outreach seems to be pretty active in social media, and including that plan or process in the proposal would further increase the auditability and transparency of the project as a whole. Also including a short paragraph of text explaining the risks and challenges, and how the team plans to deal with these would further increase the trust in the team, and show that they have a multi perspective view and deep understanding of both micro and macro aspects of the project. 
Based on the lack of information provided, I disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0:
I agree that this proposal provides a very interesting problem and its potential solution to the community.

With more and more control and monopoly coming in if certain view points of any writer in not in sync with the platforms such as google, facebook, twitter we have seen that a lot of writers now fear to express themselves as either they will be locked out OR blocked from platforms to express themselves. Therefore, in my opinion this solution, if implemented, will for the first time give the voice to such writers and allow them to not only express themselves but also be rewarded for it, the anonymoity factor is absolutely important when it comes to the implementation of this proposal. 

Nevertheless, i see a lot of improvement opportunities here, especially giving a little more details about how this dapp will work ? atleast high level of feature sets and workflow OR functionalities information would have been better, as current description is quite abstract. I see some room of improvement in write up hence 4 stars from my side.
f6_assessments.q1:
From the perspective of experience, the founders or leads of this proposal are well experienced, but for me end of the day it will come down to the developers who will implement this solution

On one hand, i can understand that the team could not get in those developers to have publicly share their details here because of limitations posted by the proposer in the comment section. However, i have to remind that there are other proposals who have done it, :) so it makes total sense to give more stars/ratings to those proposals who have done a better job at presenting themselves so that community has bigger confidence on it. 

To me i like the idea that proposer is proposing to repay the fees generated from the app, and it means that proposer is very committed to this proposal and wants to kickstart implementation of this idea. Hence, i am willing to give it 4 star, but some improvements are needed so not in complete agreement here.
f6_assessments.q2:
The good thing about this proposal is that the idea proposer is quite active in cardano community and therefore provides good confidence to community that he will be available to the community to provide good roadmap on the project. 

Nevertheless, i can see that there are lot of improvements that are required in order for this proposal to have full ratings. The plan, the KPIs, and the success metrics are missing. How the success will look like ? what is the detailed roadmap for the MVP ? The idea is abstract and it is always better to sit with your developers and come up with some basic plan on what set of functionalities your MVP will have, when you will deploy it and who will audit/provide feedback on to it ? 

Hence from the perspective of ratings i will give it 3 stars , which means i can not say for sure how likely it is that this idea can be audited and tracked perfectly.

f6_assessments.q0: This idea is excellent! Proposer clearly presents the problem with writers and offers a clear solution. This proposal if implemented, would have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem and is clearly visible in the proposal on how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem. Unfortunately, KPIs are not listed so it's hard to compare KPIs with challenge setting and proposal is not able to scale and address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: In this proposal it is clear how the proposer is looking for developers who would realize this idea. It would be good to know who is behind this proposal. Maybe some link from a proposer via LinkedIn or a website. The bearer of the idea does not have the necessary skills and knowledge needed for the realization of this idea. But if he could find developers with experience, knowledge and the necessary skills, the project surely could be realized. The proposer clearly communicates how many developers are needed in the team and most of the requested budget that is clearly presented would go to external collaborators aka developers. The budget is reasonable and broken down into identifiable items. An additional funding is required to implement the proposal but the proposer states that they will be borne by the founder and the devs. Proposer does not specify a detailed implementable plan and details of actionable tasks and order of execution are missing. Unfortunately, there is no more detailed timetable to complete the work and the possible risks have not been elaborated. In the proposal we can find the necessary resources to implement this idea but it would be better to present them in more detail. The explanation and technical aspects and technologies required for implementation are missing.
f6_assessments.q2: It would be good to have an elaborate roadmap with milestones and a time frame within which the idea would be realized. It is also necessary to present KPIs with which the success of this proposal could be measured. Unfortunately the community can't follow the development of this project in any way due to the lack of necessary data.

f6_assessments.q1:
The experience 
 of the proposer seems legit, but there is a lack of information about the rest of the team - in the proposal it specified - "3 Developers 
• Front End, Back End, UI"
But there are no names. Is those developers are already part of the team or the plan is to recruit them later? It is not clear.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem stated is the lack of publishing platforms for writers. I assume StoryTime would be the decentralized version of Amazon KDP publishing, instead of a blogging platform. If so, then this proposal fits the Challenge's needs and could drive more adoption. But if it's a blogging platform, then Publish0x and Steemit is already providing a solution. This proposal would benefit from having a clear statement on its unique selling point. What does safe and decentralized environment mean? Amazon KDP publishers face the risk of being taken down and their funds frozen if the subject material does not meet their requirements. Are StoryTime writers protected from this? There is also no KPI on how the success of this project can be measured. The proposal can be much stronger if these details are added.
f6_assessments.q1: Not enough time is spent on the technical aspect of the proposal. The proposal has a clear idea on the manpower needed for the job, but comments seem to reveal that the developers are busy with full-time jobs until January. The team's linkedin/github profiles should be shared to add credibility to the proposal. The dev cost for an MVP product is $32,000 and $9,200 is paid to the founder. More details on StoryTime's implementation needs to be included to justify the money involved. The proposal could also benefit from a section on the risks involved: what if there's too low of an adoption? What if no one finds out about StoryTime? How would censorship or quality management of published content be enforced? Just a few questions that come in my mind.
f6_assessments.q2: No roadmap with milestones for the MVP. No metrics to measure success of the project as well. The proposal would benefit from sharing some technical details as well as expected number of users/sales/books published. Maybe a comparison to Publish0x and Steemit would help? Like a chart showing the differences.
